questions.question: So on that topic, just in your sense, do you think we're alone in the universe, human beings?
How does, what we know about gases and what kind of things are necessary for life?
Well, maybe another way to ask is what is the methodology that was used to discover them?
Yeah, so with SETI, the idea is that we're both trying to hear signals and send signals, right?
What are your thoughts about Elon Musk and SpaceX, Crew Dragon, while working with NASA to launch astronauts?
So what's the closest Earth-like planet you think is worth visiting, and how hard is it?
And you know what's interesting is- Can you describe what it is first of all?
Like those pedal edges would be like, have to be like a razor and what materials can you use?
I mean, if you get star shade information flying together, I mean, how awesome is that?
I know that sounds really weird to be, how can you be born an orphan?
What did it feel like to first find out that your husband, Mike, was sick?
If that's what you would do, if you're gonna die a year from now, why don't you make it real?
What were the bucket list things for you that you realized like, what am I doing with my life?
Is there a day when we can eliminate poverty and hunger and crime and sickness?
What were the signals that in your own life were there to make you realize you're good at something?
You're like, what were you good at that made you pursue a PhD and it made you pursue the search?
We already talked about it a little bit, but let me ask again, why are we here?
